This agreement is set to provide significant market access to Indian sectors like fisheries, textiles, gems, jewellery, and leather, with a potential market size of $5.2 billion in the UK for the fisheries sector alone.

It's common to hear advice about building a fat retirement fund or aiming for the highest returns. But Radhika Gupta wants people to know that money is only useful if it also makes your present better.

Can India unite for its biggest war?The target is clear. India needs to be Viksit Bharat by 2047. But half of the second decade of this century is over like the two before. To make up for the lost decades, India needs to grow faster to be counted among high-income nations. AI is now challenging the very sector on which India grew for two decades. It's the time for reforms at a war-footing and manufacturing, not consents and dissents, but what the world needs. Because, for Indians, it is now or never.

Live: Lok Sabha braces for Op Sindoor debate, Rajnath Singh to speak at noonParliament Session 2025 Live Updates: After a week of disruptions, Parliament's Monsoon Session is now poised to witness a high-stakes debate beginning today, with the focus on the Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor — two issues deeply tied to national security and foreign policy. Both the ruling BJP-led National Democratic Alliance and the Opposition are preparing for an intense face-off in the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha. The Congress has already issued a three-line whip, directing its Lok Sabha MPs to remain present in the House for the next three days. In a rare show of consensus, the two sides have agreed to a 16-hour debate in each House — though such sessions typically spill over beyond the allotted time. Senior leaders from both camps are expected to lead the charge during what promises to be a politically charged week in Parliament. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in as we bring you the latest updates.

Efforts went in vain: Mallikarjun Kharge rues missing out on Karnataka top jobSuggesting his hopes of rising to become the Karnataka Chief Minister in 1999 suffered a setback, Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge said he worked tirelessly as the Congress Legislative Party (CLP) leader for five years, but all his efforts went in vain.

From death certificate to marriage certificate: Journey of HIV-positive IndiansBeing declared HIV-positive was akin to a death sentence in India of the 1990s. With new medicines, lifespan is not an issue any more. And now, more and more HIV-positive individuals are getting married, and having healthy kids. Matrimonial sites have launched sections focused on HIV+ individuals. This is how science and activism have turned stigma into happily-ever-after stories.
